Params: Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png
The taste of metal and salt spreads in your mouth as a booming sound fills your ears.
It sounds like the waves crashing against the cliffside, the unending sound of the tide.
You grab ahold of yourself and reorient your consciousness from these stimuli of unknown origins.
And then...
You suddenly see a small spot of light amidst the eternal darkness.
Like a moth to a flame, you desperately want to approach that ethereal light.
Driven by your desire to go forward, your legs are formed.
Motivated to touch the light, your hands are also formed.
The closer you are to the light, the more complete your self is.
The closer you are to the light, the louder the sound of the tide.
Right as your finger touches the light—
A violent quake reverberates throughout the area as if a dying star collapsing on itself.
Suddenly, light fills your vision.
But right after that—
The world returns to silent darkness.
(Open your eyes)
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory353.png
You wake up in a cold sweat as if the nightmare still has a hold on you.
Clutching your pounding heart, you open your eyes to observe your surroundings.
You are in a room that you can only describe as "dilapidated."
An old wooden bed, cracked and moldy walls, and a ceiling covered in cobwebs form the room. The smell of decay fills the air, offering a hint of how old this abandoned structure is.
Strange.
It is not just the environment—you are a stranger to yourself as well.
Why you are here, why you woke up here...
Where you came from, and where you are going...
Your mind goes blank. You cannot recall anything.
Regardless... get moving first.
You hear a voice in your heart. Following its calling, you get off the bed.
You can see a courtyard surrounded by broken fences through the window. Beyond that is a dense forest.
You seem to be in the countryside near a town.
You can also hear the faint clashes of the waves hitting the shore. You might be in a coastal area.
You step out of the room and walk downstairs.
Your movement breaks the long-held silence of this decrepit estate. The sunlight illuminates the dust in the air through the gaps of the thick musky curtains.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory388.png
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory388.png
With an extended creak, the battered front door is opened once again.
Weeds fill the unmaintained garden between you and the rusty iron gate to the forest path outside.
The world immediately becomes larger, but that only makes you feel smaller.
Is there anyone...
Before you finish speaking in your raspy voice, you seem to have caught something in the corners of your eyes.
There appears to be a small cemetery by the courtyard.
A hooded girl kneels before a gravestone.
Her head lowered and her palms clasped together, she seems to be mourning the dead buried here.
Even when you approach her, she does not move for a few minutes.
What... are you doing here?
Overwhelmed by your confusion, you cannot help but ask her. Hearing you, the girl slowly stands up.
She turns around to face you as she opens her eyes.
It was nothing...
I was simply saying goodbye.
And, even though you took longer than expected, I've been waiting for you to wake up.
Who are you...?
...Why are you waiting for me?
My name is Cradle. Who I am... is a more difficult question to answer.
Cradle
That said, I have a duty. You can even say that I was born for it.
Cradle
Stop the sound of the tide, and end the eternal cycle... Only some can accomplish this task, and my duty is to guide these people to the heart of the world.
Cradle
You can understand now why I've been waiting for you, then?
Because only you can stop the sound of the tide, and end the eternal cycle.
I should introduce myself. My name... is Cradle.
Cradle
You can consider me your servant, your companion... anything you like. My duty is to guide you.
Cradle
You are now on the "Path of the Curse Queller", which is why you woke up in a blank state.
Cradle
Your erased self will only be returned once the sound of the tide stops.
The girl named Cradle explains to you after you have forgotten everything.
Regrettably, you do not understand anything she just said.
The amount of information threatens to suffocate you.
Luckily, now you have something to ponder over.
Your body functions automatically out of forgotten habits before you realize it, processing Cradle's words over and over again, trying to deduce their meaning.
What is the "sound of the tide"?
Cradle
It is the calamity that threatens to purge the world... It is the tragedy that never ends.
Cradle
You can hear it, can't you? The surging waves that are echoing in your ears, thumping and wailing.
Indeed, you have been hearing the sound of the tide from afar since you woke up.
But what does that have to do with the "calamity"?
Cradle
You don't seem to comprehend fully.
Cradle
But that's okay. It's easier to show you than tell you.
Cradle
It's almost time, anyway.
It's almost time...?
You start to feel uneasy.
Cradle
...Hush.
She raises her index finger and holds it by your lips.
Cradle
Can you hear it?
Can you hear it?
The approaching tidal wave.
The chilling sound of the tide.
The sky darkens in an instant.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory616.jpg
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory616.jpg
Dark clouds approach from the horizon, covering the bright sky in shadows.
That is...
Only after you observe carefully do you realize that those are not storm clouds that are approaching...
That is a tidal wave that is large enough to cover the sky.
You cannot move as if your feet were nailed to the ground.
There is no reason to run. There is no way you can outrun it.
Several breaths later, the tide is already visible to you.
Cradle
The tide that will devour all... Nothing can survive its wrath.
Cradle
We are out of luck this time, but that's alright. There's always next time.
Next time?
The thunderous tide gets closer and closer, almost deafening you.
Cradle
I'll see you soon, then.
The girl smiles as she says it.
Then she closes her eyes before you are both taken by the world-ending tide.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png
(Open your eyes)
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryZhengyanNew.prefab
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory353.png
You wake up in a cold sweat as if the nightmare still has a hold on you.
Clutching your pounding heart, you open your eyes to observe your surroundings.
An old wooden bed, cracked and moldy walls, and a ceiling covered in cobwebs form the room... It is the same view as before.
You have woken up in the same room.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory388.png
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory388.png
Realizing something, you rush out of the crumbled house. Unsurprisingly, you run into the hooded girl in the cemetery again.
Cradle
We meet again.
Cradle
Our time was brief, but you must have remembered my name, right?
Is this... the cycle you were talking about?
Cradle
That's right. The great tide surges from the depths of the ocean after a set period of time, devouring all.
Cradle
Afterward, everything is reset to how it was in the "beginning."
Cradle
People forget what they have experienced, and they forget the calamity that is coming.
Cradle
Time has therefore stopped. Tomorrow doesn't arrive for anyone.
But neither of us has forgotten the tide.
Cradle
Hence why we need people like you to stop it.
What is happening to this world?
Cradle
Cradle
...This world was destroyed once.
Cradle
After the age of myths, the surviving humans began to rebuild their civilizations on top of the ruins of the war.
Cradle
But the wisdom of the ancients became undecipherable mysteries. People had to start from nothing, slowly repeating what had happened.
Cradle
Somewhere along the way, the sound of the tide began to appear.
Cradle
It destroyed the world over and over again as if trying to keep humanity's future locked away.
Cradle
...That is the state of the world now. But don't think that I have all the answers.
Cradle
I have no knowledge of your past or where the sound of the tide came from.
Cradle
I was assigned a duty, and I'm simply doing what I've been tasked to do.
So... stopping the sound of the tide is my duty?
Why should I trust you?
Cradle
A quick learner!
Cradle
No one knows why the world is the way it is.
Cradle
In my opinion, however, let's figure out the "how"" before the ""why."
Cradle
The calamity is right before us. If we don't want the same tragedy to repeat...
Cradle
We must take action right now.
Cradle
Hmm... Why wouldn't you believe me?
Cradle
But it doesn't matter if you trust me or not.
Cradle
Just like how my duty is to guide you, yours is to stop the sound of the tide.
Cradle
That is something you cannot escape.
Cradle
So, feel free to leave me and travel somewhere else.
Cradle
I believe that you will return here, and before that happens, I'll be waiting.
You do not seem to have a choice.
You do not know the true nature of the sound of the tide or why you have been given this duty...
But you must take action first, as Cradle said.
Cradle
In that case, allow me to accompany you if you don't have a concrete plan yet.
Cradle
There is a small town by the shore nearby. You can familiarize your whereabouts there.
Cradle
You can act after you make up your mind. There's no rush.
I don't seem to have a choice, anyway.
Cradle
Cradle
I'm sorry.
Cradle
But I can promise you something, even in this world with very few guarantees.
Cradle
No matter how your journey ends...
Cradle
I'll be there with you until the very last moment.
